intro: Parasponia eurhyncha, commonly known as the climbing parasponia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a perennial vine that exhibits a unique parasitic relationship with its host plants, deriving nutrients through specialized structures called haustoria. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Parasponia eurhyncha is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is commonly found in humid, shaded environments.
